thread.title: The Funniest Tweets From Parents This Week
thread.title_full: The Funniest Tweets From Parents This Week

author: Hollis Miller
title: The Funniest Tweets From Parents This Week
text: ‚Äî Emily McCombs (@msemilymccombs) February 15, 2017 It's cute how I continue to take my kids to the mall expecting to do anything other than ride up and down the escalators. ‚Äî Mommy Owl (@Lhlodder) February 16, 2017 For Valentine's Day, I gave my wife and daughters candy.They gave me the flu.I still acted like I loved it. ‚Äî James Breakwell (@XplodingUnicorn) February 14, 2017 My daughter can't eat an apple without first acting out the evil witch scene from Snow White. üçé #disneykids ‚Äî Jennifer Borget (@JenniferBorget) February 16, 2017 My toddler locked himself in his room. So we both win. ‚Äî The ParentNormal (@ParentNormal) February 16, 2017 5YO: "I've been on this timeout for hours. Look it up. Check Google." ‚Äî Jan Moyer (@moyermama) February 16, 2017 Book title, "Parenting a Strong-willed Child"Loosely translated, "So You've got Yourself a Little Asshole" ‚Äî she's unfiltered (@MommaUnfiltered) February 16, 2017 My valentine plans this year mostly just involve shuttling my son to soccer practice. ‚Äî Sara Says Stop (@PetrickSara) February 13, 2017 Before bedtime: JESUS CHRIST THESE KIDS NEED TO GO TO SLEEP 1 hour later: [scrolling thru pics of the kids on my phone] awww I miss them 7yo: "Does our Netflix have to be called 'The Boys' or can we change it?"Me: "You can call it whatever you want."7yo: "YES!"
